intro: Marrubium vulgare var. vaillantii, commonly known as Vaillant's horehound, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or along coastal areas. It has a strong, aromatic scent and is known for its medicinal properties, including potential anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic effects. This variety is often confused with other horehound species due to its similar appearance.
